Reviews.Title: “Easyjet trip”
Reviews.Author: Sue F
Reviews.Content: We had a twin room that was comfortable and clean. Disappointed that no tea/coffee making facilities or English channel on the TV. Staff very helpful in all area. The hotel close to Sagrada Familia. We walked to the zoo, which is terrific, Las Ramblas, the port area for a boat trip. Enjoyable 2 night break, but very cold.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MaineUSA1234
Reviews.Content: We were booked in this hotel via Gate1 Travel (who usually has good picks) and were disappointed in the quality and service as well as the remote location - 11 long city blocks+ to get to the city center and Ramblas. Hotel room was small, walls dirty and bed hard a a board. Breakfast buffet was so bad, we ate elsewhere all 3 days. The front desk staff was cordial and spoke English, however very indifferent to my problems connecting to the in hotel wi-fi. I would not recommend this hotel - it is a 2 star, if that, certainly not 3 stars. You can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Where We Needed To Be”
Reviews.Author: Helen D
Reviews.Content: Good basic hotel in the centre of everywhere. 20mins walk to all major attractions. Reception and restaurant staff helpful and pleasant. Visited old stomping ground plus new sights. Did a hop on/off sight seeing bus did the red and blue route to get back to the Sagrada Familia Cathedral which was only a few minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't - not for the money”
Reviews.Author: Wombat R
Reviews.Content: Award-winning sense of disenchantment here. More of a glorified motel - definitely not a hotel: one-person reception at night, can’t call down to reception, they couldn't bring anything up (like a pillow or blanket). If you’re happy to throw away good money for such little service, then you have enough money to book somewhere else. Someone is making good money just renting rooms with no added extras, like staff. Thanks to Flight Center again for such a poor booking choice - I wouldn't trust their recommendations again - second bad hotel. Breakfast – you won’t get powdered scrambled eggs like these anywhere else since WWII. The hallways are all timber so you hear every 'clack' of people walking by and rolling their suitcases, luckily we were mid week. Good luck. Help them improve their business and service – don’t go there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dickens052
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night on the day before embarking on a cruise. Front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. Check in was efficient and as an added bonus we were able to check in quite early after having arrived on a morning flight. The hotel emailed us directions using public transportation from the airport. However the 3 block walk from the metro was a bit confusing as the streets aren't marked that well. I would recommend asking the hotel for more specific directions after getting off the metro. Our room was very clean and a good size. We were quite comfortable. Breakfast was not included in our room rate so we had a quick coffee and croissant at a local cafe which was much more reasonable. The hotel was only about 4 blocks from Sagrada Familia where you can also catch the Barcelona BusTuristic (hop on/off). Ask for a discount coupon at the hotel. The hotel also has a small lounge where one can use the computer. We enjoyed our one night there even though the hotel is in a quieter area. We felt that the hotel was in a safe area and did a lot of walking. We would not hesitate in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: marial27
Reviews.Content: this was a very nice hotel located in a pleasant neighborhood. it was near some of the major sites we wanted to explore and close to public transportation that we used to go everywhere. i would recommend though that they invest in a machine to squeeze fresh orange juice as well as good coffee or espresso machine. They had an instant machine that made horrible coffee and the orange juice tasted like cool aide. This was totally unacceptable. however, the staff was friendly professional and helpful. overall my experience was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Utilitarian hotel”
Reviews.Author: uprisesthemoon
Reviews.Content: There's not much going on in the neighborhood (though it is an easy walk to Sagrada Familia). The hotel itself is clean and the front desk was reasonably friendly. The cleaning staff was loud and made it impossible to sleep in past 7am. We were very lucky to have a room with a nice street view, so I'm grateful for that. All TV channels were Spanish language. We stayed for 4 days and it was relatively pleasant for the price. No major complaints, but no reason to rave either.

Reviews.Title: “Only OK - could probably get nicer hotels for the same price”
Reviews.Author: C_Sutty
Reviews.Content: I booked this for 2 nights as part of a 4 night trip for leisure and business. Reception staff were efficient and polite - we needed directions to the Hotel from the station and the reception manager was very helpful in directing us over the phone. The Hotel was in a fairly quiet district, near to the Sagrada Familia, but quite a distance from the main hubbub of the city. Otherwise, the room was modern, clean and minimalist, not much furniture and wooden flooring. The room was booked through Lastminute.com and maybe that's why we had a dark gloomy room overlooking the back interior block on the second floor of a 7 floor hotel - in the morning you had to crank your neck to look up to see daylight through the window! We needed the light on in the morning (despite blues skies and 80 degrees outside) to get dressed. We didn't bother with breakfast which amounted I believe to a coffee and pastry for 5 euros. The bed was incredibly hard and uncomfy (even with a preference for a firm mattress!) and was marginally better than a park bench I would imagine. On the plus side the bathroom was quite large and there was a full length bath which was nice. There was free use of a computer and internet in the guest lounge which proved useful. Overall I certainly wouldn't bother booking here again, but as there is so much choice in Barcelona thankfully I wouldn't have to.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: Gaggers
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very helpful and friendly. Room cleanliness and comfort was fine. TV - it would help if there was a choice other than the free-to-air Spanish TV which is not the best. Our deal included breakfast which was more a means of getting sustenance than a source of pleasure... We had a twin room which looked out onto an interior wall. However, the room was pleasant and a good size. Some of the doubles with street views are quite small, so it's worth having a look if you can. Location was ok - you can walk to a number of points of interest and there are a couple of metro stations within five minutes walk. Barcelona's metro is fantastic - take a good map with Metro stops and points of interest and it's an easy city to navigate. I would recommend using this rather than the very expensive tourist buses which are at times full and go around long loops meaning they don't offer a lot of flexibility.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, unfussy hotel”
Reviews.Author: enu1hrab
Reviews.Content: We returned from Barcelona last night having spent 4 nights at the Aranea. Room 104 is above the Reception on the corner of a very busy road, but with the windows closed, it all but blocked out the traffice noise, and we slept extremely well. The room was well presented, clean and modern, with more than enough space, and the bathroom was large and very pleasant . Towels/bedding were changed during our stay. We ate breakfast just along the road at a little patisserie ... 5 Euros for the two of us for 3 coffees and 2 large croissants - considerably less than the 24 Euros we would have had to pay at the hotel (although admittedly I guess we would have had more choice). Sagrada Familia 10 minutes walk from hotel, Casa Pedrera less than 20, otherwise about 30 mins to Ramblas. We tended to walk everywhere, but used the Metro on a couple of occasions; 1 Euro 45 for any one journey. No complaints at all (only that I would have been quite happy to stay for a couple more days).

Reviews.Title: “The Staff were rude”
Reviews.Author: mosswoodthredbo
Reviews.Content: The staff were rude. We were not informed of changes to our initially booking when we decided to spend an additional couple of days. We were charged extra for breakfast when the initial booking included breakfast even though the cost was exactly the same. The staff in the breakfst room demanded a cash payment - her words included "if I tell you to pay, you pay me" - which we declined. We spoke with a manager who acknowledged the staff member in question was rude, however, was not interested in discussing the matter as we were booking out that day. I note that we were provided breakfast on the additional days and this matter of extra costs for breakfast was never raised.

Reviews.Title: “We cancelled elsewhere and came back”
Reviews.Author: CrosleyShelvador
Reviews.Content: My wife & I traveled to Europe for a wedding followed by several days on our own in Barcelona. We had booked elsewhere but later needed a one-day stopover outbound and decided to try the Aranea and were pleased all 'round. On our return to Barcelona, we found the well-rated (and more costly) hotel we had booked was a great disappointment (a dump) and changed our last day back to the Aranea so our final memories would be more pleasant. The rooms are clean, recently renovated and spacious (compared to The Praktik). Very clean with modern finishes. Rooms on the street can be noisy at odd times - such as when the bars close - but the street-life adds to the charm of this mixed residential and commercial neighborhood. All necessities are within one block: Tapes, market, farmacie, cafe americano, ATMs. Our thanks to the very professional staff and a special 'gracie' to Ruben, who makes all things happen smoothly. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Jmsp80
Reviews.Content: Went to Barcelona for a citybreak. And stayed at Aranea for 2 nights (140 euros). Got there by bus from the airport to Plaza Cataluña and then a 10 minute walk to the hotel (very easy to reach). When we arrived, fast check in and got to the room. Unfortunatelly it was quite smelly! but that was the only bad thing. Oppened the window for a little, and problem solved. The room was nice and clean, but in need for a little cosmetic upgrade. We could see the top of "Sagrada Familia" from our room, reachable in less than 10 mins walk. The breakfast was nice but not great :). The underground is 500mt away. I would return there... comparing prices in barcelona it was a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Some staff need a personality by-pass”
Reviews.Author: cityslicker1002
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location near Sagrada Famillia (5 mins) and metro station - Monumental, The room is a bit on the small side and would have to question wether it actually was for 1 person.Would have to agree with other reviews with regards the walls being paper thin as at times was rather noisy.The breakfast was poor to say the least although plentiful and the staff serving it drastically need a personality by-pass as they were ignorant,miserable and rude! Reception staff were polite and helpful. Would not stay at this hotel again but will definetly be going back to Barcelona again as it is a wonderful city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the deal...great for what you're paying for”
Reviews.Author: nycscribe
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor before booking it through Gate 1 travel. Four nights and airfare from NYC just $620 per person. You can't beat that! I loved the location in the Eixample neighborhood - a couple of blocks from Sagrada Familia, and the same neighborhood as some of the famous Gaudi houses like Casa Batllo. (But check out Casa Asia - even more stunning, less people and free!). The bathrooms are very nice and clean. A beautiful sunny window opened up onto Consell de Cent. Everything in central Barcelona is within walking distance - La Rambla - the old city. Cafes, tapas bars, restaurants. The hop on hop off bus "turistic" was a great deal since it goes up to Parc Guell...over to Montjuic...down to the harbor. The breakfast was fine...just about anything you could want from a preset buffet. The hotel staff were very, very helpful and friendly. Downside? It's true - the beds are rock hard. I actually slipped folded blankets under the mattress pads to give some softness. I like a firm mattress but this was as funny as an I Love Lucy episode. And for some reason - the a/c was not working. It was Nov...but warm and beautiful and at night you cannot leave the picture window open because of the noise of motorcycles, cars and people passing by late into the night. Hence, the room was so hot. There is a beautiful rooftop and view but all of the lounge chairs were stacked and chained up. :( Would I stay here again? No. Would I stay in the neighborhood and pay a little extra for more comfort and luxuriousness? Yes. This trip to Barcelona was glorious. Truly spectacular. You must go. (Don't miss the Roman ruins underneath the Museum of the City. Free on Sun from 3-8pm.) Have fun!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good base”
Reviews.Author: audbod3
Reviews.Content: Good location although a short walk to las ramblas etc, only breakfast available but that was good as it made us go and try different places. Room was clean, the sheets on my single bed on arrival had rusty marks but were very quickly changed by maids. reception staff were very pleasant. Breakfast was good, cold meats, bread, cheese, bacon, scrambled eggs, fruit juice, coffee, tea, pastries, yoghurt and fruit. Fridge in room. No kettle in room but there was a vending machine on the first floor. Roof terrace was nice, never used it but looked ok for lying on loungers. No bar in hotel but we kept wine in the fridge for late night drink!! Hotels4u was very good prices!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, walking distance to local attractions”
Reviews.Author: AndyK_IRL
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a quiet area on the corner of Carrer Napols & Consell de Cent. There is not much around the hotel it self but it is walking distance. 30 minutes direct walk to Port Olympic & the beaches, 15 minutes to La Rambla & Pl Cataluna. The room I had was a single (Even though I had booked a double) but it did have everything, Ensuite, Safe, TV (Spanish Channels) & Mini-Bar fridge which i was able to use to store water, fruit & other food. There is a supermarket a couple of doors down from the hotel. The hotel is kept clean and is in a safe spot to walk to/from at night. There has limited services, if there is a hotel bar as advertised i couldn't find one but as a place to lay your head for a few nights i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay but...”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirl2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay. I actually switched from a hostel to this hotel, so it was a great move. However, for the amount I paid to stay here, I expected to not have to sleep on a bed and pillows that felt like bricks, to not be hit in the head by the shower head, to not have a stocked minifridge (which smelled like rotten fruit), and to not pay eleven euros for a breakfast that consisted of eggs that tasted like flour and fish, old yogurt, warm meats and cheese (that should have been cool/cold), and wilted salad. To anyone who decides to stay here: you should know that you will not have access to internet nor a public computer, and you will wake up with cramps from the sleeping conditions. If you're looking for somewhere close to Sagrada Familia and other various sites that won't cost you an arm and a leg, stay here, but don't buy the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: CaveatConsumers
Reviews.Content: Clean, laminate floors a plus. Staff friendly and English speaking. Quiet area. A few blocks from Monumental metro. Did not try the breakfast but there are plenty of coffee shops/restaurants/pastry shops nearby. Also there is a supermarket around the corner and our room had a small fridge which was meant as a mini bar but had room for our supermarket purchases.. Air conditioning worked well. Bathroom had nice extra amenities such as comb, toothbrush. Pillows, like most other European hotels, leave a lot to be desired by spoiled Americans such as me. The bathroom was nicely decorated. Wi-Fi is free but slow.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShrewsburyChefette
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 15 minute stroll into the centre of Barcelona and 10 minutes to the Sagrada.It's in a quiet neighbourhood and a good location.The staff were extremely helpful.The room was very spacious and we had a lovely view of the square outside,at times a little noisy ,but we were in a city.The bed was probably a little less soft than we were used to,but we slept like logs.There is a mini bar in the room which was sparcely stocked,but was handy for the beers,drinks and nibbles we'd bought.There's a good safe in the room .There aren't any facilities for tea making,but as they don't have them on the continent antway,we took our own.There aren't any english programmes on the tv,but as it's Spain we didn't mind.The air con was really good.The bathroom was a little on the small side but adequate for what we wanted.The towels were large and soft.There were plenty of good quality toiletries,to the point of we didn't need most of ours. The breakfast was very good too.There was bacon and scrambled egg on the hot side and then the usual and more for the continental breakfast.There is not a restaurant service or bar in the evenings,but there are lots of bars and good restaurants in the area for all budgets.There is also a good supermarket a few doors down and is pretty reasonable. We used the tourist hop on bus for a couple of days to see as much of the city as possible.It was about £23 each for the two days and was great value,there are three different routes to take all for the same price.There is also a booklet of loads of discount vouchers.Try to get on the bus asap to avoid the queues.We loved the hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “3-Star Prices, 2-Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: ElleninCA
Reviews.Content: My tiny room at the Aranea was sparkling clean, and done up in pretty cherry-colored wood. That's the good news. Not so good: An older woman traveling alone, I was not offered help with my luggage. The wood flooring in my room turned out to be an artificial material that made every step reverberate. I heard every step my neighbors took through evidently thin walls. The mattress on the bed was monastically hard. The so-called double bed was more like an ample twin. Just one long but narrow bed pillow was provided, together with a small upholstered pillow - hardly sufficient for propping oneself up in bed to read or watch the TV, which could only be watched from bed since there was no chair in the room. When propped up in bed, I quickly learned to be careful not to lean back too comfortably, since doing so would propel the bed, on casters, away from the wall. The hotel offers free Internet access from a computer located in a common room, but it was out of service for 3 of the 4 days I was there. The Aranea restaurant offers a buffet breakfast and lunch, but no dinner. The breakfast buffet offered ample selections but mediocre quality. Cafe con leche and juice were dispensed by machines. Not having signed up for breakfast included in my room charge, I was charged a whopping 11 Euros for the mediocre breakfast fare. I quickly learned to go elsewhere. The hotel advertises that room service is offered in the morning, but when I called for coffee to be brought to my room Sunday morning, I was told without apology that no room service was available. The neighborhood, on the southern border of the Eixample district, has several restaurants but is otherwise a bit off the beaten path, with gritty touches, The saving grace is a Metro station just 3 blocks away. But be forewarned, many Barcelona restaurants and businesses shut down early on Sunday. With no evening meal offered by the hotel restaurant, I wandered the streets hungrily looking for Sunday supper until I finally found a falafel place that was open several blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Mihai1
Reviews.Content: Central located hotel in a quite area. Very close to Sagrada, 20 minutes walk from Las Ramblas.The room is small but comfortable. Very nice breakfast with a lot of various food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: 15mick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aranea for 3 nights. It was a lovely hotel. Very clean. The room although small was perfectly adequet. Neat, comfy beds, excellent shower and bathroom. They were also cleaned and made up daily. The staff were very helpful and friendly. It was a very cold spell when we were there. Extra blankets supplied and the air con became an excellent room heater. We always check T A when going anywhere but you do have to take some reviews with a pinch of salt. (There seems to be quite a few moaning minnies about!!!). I'm glad we did regarding the following. The continental breakfast was very good. Plenty of ham, cheese, salami and rolls. Fruit, yoghurts, cerial and jam. Pastries and cakes. Ok the bacon, sausage and egg were a typical spanish attempt. But if it's an English breakfast you want, book an Hotel in Blackpool--not Barcelona!!!! The location was very good. The 20 minute walk to Las Ramblas was interesting with nice sights along the way. The 2 tourist bus routes are 5 and 7 minutes away and if you fly into Gerona and get the Barcelona bus transfer. The bus station is a 5 minute walk down 1road to the hotel. The Olympic port and beach are about a 25 minute walk. We considered the Aranea very good value and would recommend it. Michael and Sam. Lancashire

Reviews.Title: “Functional, well positioned, clean”
Reviews.Author: MrsMT Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small but clean, very well located to reach sights on foot or by underground (in a very safe area), the staff is very helpfull and speak a range of languages, but the breakfast is quite bad. Not for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast very poor, room small, not what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: asdfEngland Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is poor there was no mini bar in the room, the room was small the breakfast was very poor, the food was rubbish just very fat bacon covered in grease and scrambled eggs, a few cold meats no choice of cheese. We had to ask for them to be filled up and they took there time about it, coffee ran out and even had to wait for them to clear the tables after others had gone. The service was appalling and i would not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Barely adequate”
Reviews.Author: Lufcdeano
Reviews.Content: Booked a doubleroom in this hotel for two nights, the decisive factor was 10 min straight walk to the barcelona nord bus-station down the same street. The hotel is extremely easy to find, and the staff at reception speaks good english and was helpful. You can leave your bags at the hotel if your departure is after the checkout time and you feel like doing some late sightseeing. The problems start in the room, there is absolutely nothing wrong with the way it looks, but first of all the bed was quite hard to sleep on, might not be a problem for someone weighing closer to 100kg... The shower lacked pressure making the washing a bit of a challenge. The bathroom in general is quite well equipped with bidé, bathtube, (weak) hairdryer. The room was equipped with very good air conditioner. Nowadays the tv's in hotels are starting to be lcd-models, but Aranea has kept old tubescreens. In our room the antennasocket of the tv was so loose, that it was a matter of luck with setting the cable in right position to be able to give us some sort of picture out of the machine:) We had our room in 6th floor, but were still able to hear traffic noise down from the street, didnt bother our sleep though, but i can only imagine how it is on the floors below in case the window is on streetside.. Despite all this i was ok with Aranea, just a few improvements and the hotel would really be worth 80e/per night price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Will Be Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: Gail B.
Reviews.Content: Recently spent four days in Barcelona. I was lucky enough to pick a good hotel. After agonizing over the positive & negative revues, I settled on the Aranea. Yes, there is something everywhere that is not to the liking, but for a reasonably priced hotel, I think some of the revues were a bit harsh. Yes, the halls and plumbing are a bit loud and as far as the bed comfort-want a pillowtop, stay at the high-priced five star hotels. The cleanliness of the hotel is important to me and the Aranea did not fail. The location, I felt, was a bit of a walk to the center city, but the metro was not that difficult to reach. After a busy day sight-seeing, I appreciated the quiet neighborhood location. The staff was pleasant, helpful and answered any questions. I did have a problem with the hair dryer not working properly, but a replacement was supplied within 15 minutes. When I return, I will stay at the Aranea.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but need your walking shoes!”
Reviews.Author: phoenix_81
Reviews.Content: I found that overall this was a good choice of hotel, especially for the price but not sure if I would choose to stay again. Myself and my friend both found it a little to far out for our liking. It is within walking distance of the main precinct around the Ramblas but it is a good 20 mins or so, which considering the heat in July was not always a pleasant prospect. The area around the hotel is pretty safe and quiet, but there is very little of much interest in the near vacinity of the hotel, just a few small bars, non of which looked particularly appealing to us. The lady on reception (who seemed to practically live at the hotel) was very pleasant and always willing to help. Check in was quick and easy, only problem was upon arrival we found out that they had overbooked the twin rooms and so for our first night I wound up with a camp bed! they did allow us to move the following day though. Our room was pleasant with a lovely big bathroom, and very clean, only complaint with the room was that the beds were a little too hard for my liking (I was actually wishing I'd kept the camp bed). Breakfast was enjoyable and plentiful providing you arrived early as the waiting staff were not very swift at re-stocking items at the buffet, on more than one occasion people were having to ask for specific things as no one seemed interested in re-filling anything. The buffet was your usual fair for a European hotel, bacon & eggs and a range of pastries, ham, cheese & fruit. Tip: if you do not like strong (and I do mean strong) coffee stick to fruit juice. The hotel also provides free internet access which came in handy, first thing in the morning or late at night is your best bet for using this if you don't want to have to que for the computer. There was also a sun terrace, but I was a little disappointed with it. Easy to get a lounger as no one seemed to use it, which I understood as it wasn't particularly pleasant and since the bar didn't seem to open in the hotel (despite notices saying it did) you couldn't even get a drink to take out with you. All in all I found my stay a pleasant one, and while I can't say there were any major faults with the hotel I can't say that there was anything about it that would make me stay there again either.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Well Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmmrph
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious, well maintained and attractively decorated. The bed is reasonably comfortable. There was no noise from the street, at least not on 5th floor where we stayed. The street the hotel is located on has many cafes and shops nearby. It is a 10-15 minute walk to the metro, about 6 blocks or so. The breakfast buffet (12 E) if you did not pay in advance with your room is horribly overpriced. You can get some coffee and muffins or bread at any number of shops nearby. Easy to get to many of the tourist attractions either by walking or the metro. All in all, a very pleasant place to stay and would definitely consider them again when in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the Sagrada Familia, not so ideal for Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: elbowsoffthetables
Reviews.Content: My review scores pretty much say it all, the hotel was fantastic value for money, having been found for an amazing deal and offering luxury that was unprecedented for the price of the accommodation. However, the location might be a bit too far out for those wanting to be right in the thick of the central Barcelona action, although an on the spot learning of the excellent tube network that Barcelona has to offer (with the nearest stop being just 5 minutes walk away from the hotel) meant that the location could be made up for the excellent value for money that was present. Additionally, the Sagrada Familia is located just 10 minutes walk away from the hotel (which would definitely have to be reached by tube or taxi if staying in a more central location).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean hotel, but long distance from nearest metro station”
Reviews.Author: Ladyin40s
Reviews.Content: Large double room, clean bathroom, in nice, quiet location. But 4-5 blocks away from the nearest metro station. Nice service and but not very good at English language. Didn't try their breakfast as there was an excellent bread-pasterie store in 30m of the main entrance, straight the other side of the road. Shoap only from shower-gel bottle. TV channels only Spanish (except for CNN).

Reviews.Title: “Good value location, mind the noise and cruise hoards”
Reviews.Author: tastravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my mother at the Apsis earlier this month. This was a return visit to Barcelona for me and I was familiar with the Eixample area. For clarification you may find this hotel on the web under Apsis Atrium as well. It seems to have changed hands or merged recently. The hotel is in a great location just a block off the Passeig de Gracia, near food and shopping and very close to metro. It is also in a central position to Gaudi's Casa Batllo and Casa Mila. If you are a fine walker, you would also have no trouble reaching Las Ramblas from the hotel. We had a double room with a balcony and it was very large by European standards. The bathroom was also large. The room was kept spotless. Do not worry yourself with a balcony, though. The road below is VERY noisy- too noisy for a nice sangria on the balcony in the evening. The balcony doors were soundproof, though. We never heard a peep when they were closed. Breakfast was good with eggs, bacon, pastries, and cereals. Plenty for anyone. The front desk staff was very helpful. My baggage didn't make it on my flight with me, and the desk staff called the airport to make sure the bag would be delivered to the hotel (the lost baggage folks at the airport we not very organized). The one negative I have with the Apsis is that it seems to be a haven for the big cruise lines. We stayed a week and saw 3 different cruise companies come in and out. The elevator was packed with luggage most of the time. Just leave yourself extra time to check in or out in case you encounter the cruise hoards and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as it seems”
Reviews.Author: oopeena
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Aranea for 3 nights in December and were disappointed. The hotel seems very nice if you look the photos from their internet site, but it's not as nice in real life. Our room was clean, but it wasn't in great condition. Both bedside lamps were loosily fastened to wall, so they were crooked, there was some traces on the walls and our minibar was already missing one bottle of water. Also beds are pretty hard, but that's quite common in many hotels. Our room was on the top floor, just opposite from the elevator, which made lot of noise everytime someone used it. Staff was rude, for instance one night we took a walk, it was around nine o'clock, and when we came back, the front door didn't open (they have these sliding doors there). We could see there was a guy behind the counter in reception, but he just read a magazine and didn't look up once. We tried to get his attention by waving to him, but nothing. We couldn't find a buzzer, so we just had to wait. Luckily there was this older wealthy looking couple coming out, so the reception guy had to get up his butt to open the door for them. We then got inside, but there was no greeting of any kind from the reception guy. In fact, the whole time we were there, we weren't greeted or noticed by anyone of the staff. Not even when we first came. It's the first time we've met rude spanish people, and we've been to Spain many times!! Location was pretty good, Sagrada Familia is just few blocks away and it's not that far from the Rambla either. We like to walk, so we always walked back to our hotel from the Rambla. There is also a metro stop near by.

Reviews.Title: “be careful to "double" rooms if they give you nr 2 (102, 202, 302....)”
Reviews.Author: Crippy15
Reviews.Content: We reserved well in advance a double room, but when we arrived there they gave us a large SINGLE room, telling us it was a double one.... The bed was 120cm large, and one side was next to the wall so that it wasn't possible to have access from both sides... When we complained, they told us that it was a double room, but if we wanted we could move to a larger one.... the following day, since it was all booked. The quickness of the answer made clear that they knew it was a single one.... The following day we had to prepare our luggage, leave it at the reception and come back in the afternoon.... and take our own luggage to bring it in the new room, they didn't even ask us if we wanted to have it moved by them during the day... Be carefull if you reserve a double room and they give you a room number 2: 102, 202, 502 etc: they are all the same, large SINGLE rooms! The new room was OK apart from the electricity box (strangely noisy after 2 hours we had the lights on..... it went on all the night...) and the magnetic key was to be re-magnetised every evening.... On the whole, it wasn't bad, but only because due to the time period, we reserved with a high discount..... Well located, anyway, and clean

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy, but nice enough”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel via Venere.com for our New Years break,and had a good stay there. The room was a good size and very clean. I thought it was very reasonably priced for the location,very cheap minibar too. They put us in a smoking room without asking though, fortunately it didn't smell of stale smoke at all like they often do. The hotels in a good location,just 5 minutes walk from La Sagrada Familia and Barcelona Nord Bus Station, and we felt perfectly safe wandering round the area on our retuurn from nights out. The staff, whilst not very chatty, were professional and efficient. Only problem really was the thin walls which meant we could hear other guests through them!

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: glassyraven
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, friendly hotel in a pleasant neighborhood. We stayed 3 nights, were very pleased and would stay here again. Our room was comfortable and had a nice view of the street. Our taxi driver from the airport got miffed when we put only our 2 wheelies in his trunk/boot and insisted on keeping our hand baggage with us. He insisted on seeing a written address for the hotel. When we arrived, the meter showed 20.05 euro, and the driver proceeded to add 7.20 euro for bags, ?, ?, and 10% for ?. It looked like the bags in the boot were about 1 euro each (I thought someone had written 6 euros each, which had seemed pretty steep, and was why we insisted on only 2 bags in the trunk). I didn't understand what the 10% was for, so I may have tipped him twice unintentionally. Incidentally, if you arrive in the Int'l terminal, the taxi queue is to your left, as you exit to the street (a baggage cart may be hiding the small taxi sign.) The hotel staff at the desk were very friendly and helpful. We arrived prior to check-in time, but they had a room to store our luggage, so we had coffee and toured the neighborhood until our room was ready. We ate lunch/dinner at one of the small restaurants down the street to your right as you exit the hotel. Had the menu del dias for 10.71 euro (9.71 week days) -- starter, entree, dessert, 1/4 liter vino. The English menu didn't include the menu del dias, but at least had the translations for most of the offerings -- and we asked for it anyway -- that's what everyone around us was having. Very good food and particularly nice mixed vegetable (hot) plate, generous portions. We were the only non-Spanish speakers there -- very charming, friendly local place. Like others, we had coffee and croissants for breakfast at a nearby cafe with outside tables on the intersection in front of the hotel. You can walk to the Picasso museum (closed on Mondays when we were there in late September -- naturally, we went there on Monday). It's about 2 km, according to our Garmin GPS, which directed us down Saint Joan for a bit, then through the narrow, winding streets of old Barcelona -- interesting, Moorish character. Google maps routes you down Carrer de Roger de Flor, which parallels Saint Joan and looks much simpler, but then you miss the old narrow streets (that you may need a GPS to navigate without a good map).

Reviews.Title: “Theft From Room By Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dollar76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of September. On our first evening out, after checking in, we returned to find that money had been stolen from our room.Our room door hadn't been forced so entry must have been made by staff. We reported this to the girl on reception who didn't seem overly interested but eventually agreed to check the cameras on our floor. After giving her most of the day to investigate she still hadn't bothered to look but luckily there was another receptionist who made more of an effort and filled in a report. On checkout we made sure that they had all of our contact details and we were assured we'd be kept in the loop. We have not heard anything since. I have sent numerous emails to Apsis and not recieved a single reply. In conclusion - APSIS CONDONE THEFT BY STAFF.

Reviews.Title: “good location, near metro”
Reviews.Author: ae398
Reviews.Content: very good hotel. close to 3 difft metro stations. Girona station is the closest.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, Good Loacation”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie99
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aranea is certainly not the best hotel I have ever stayed in, but it is by no means anywhere close to the worst. I booked my stay at this hotel because of the price, location and positive reviews that I had read. All I was looking for was a clean and efficient place to stay for a decent cost, and this hotel definitely fit the bill. Overall, I enjoyed my stay. The staff was both bilingual and helpful in regards to any questions I had. My hotel room was clean and rather comfortable despite its simplicity. My only minor complaints are that the walls looked like they could have used a fresh coat of paint and despite adjusting the thermostat, the room always seemed freezing (thank goodness the windows opened). The hotel is located a 5-10 minute walk from the Tetuan metro station, which made traveling to/from the airport and getting around the city easy and quick. The surrounding neighborhood seemed safe and offered plenty of bar/restaurants, internet cafes, and supermarkets. If you are looking for a clean, friendly hotel in a decent location and the price is right, then I don't think you would be disappointed in selecting Hotel Aranea.

Reviews.Title: “Will return again”
Reviews.Author: Joe63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Aranea Hotel and would definitely return. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and very good for the price. We were in a room that faced a wall when looking out the window but it was very quiet. Location was fine for us as we are walkers. We were within 15-20 mins of all the major sites. Highly reccomend a stay here. Oh, and the breakfast each day was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not as described in other reviews”
Reviews.Author: EoinMeath
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in a good location. It is in china town and doesn't feel safe at night after walking a few blocks. The beds were very hard and uncomfortable and the walls in our room were filthy. Room was small and had no view. The floors and walls in this hotel are paper thin and you could hear every movement in other rooms both above and beside you. ( Quite annoying when you are trying to sleep in.) Good points. Cheap and Air con good. Didn't ruin holiday because city is great...

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location and service, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Diego_W
Reviews.Content: Now that I've been at the hotel I can´t believe how misleading some reviews can be. There is no way to call this hotel's location even good. Basically you have to take the metro anywhere you want to go, maybe except La Sagrada Familia. This is not as bad as could be because Barcelona has a great (an affordable) transport systems. Also the area, although being very safe and quiet, has another problem, which is that there is not one decent place around to dine or even have breakfast. On the good side: The room and bathroom were spacious for European standards and everything was really clean. We had free wireless access in the room, which was a plus until it broke and wasn't fixed for two days. As mentioned in other reviews the staff is really unattentive (won't even nod at you when you come in) giving the hotel a really cold atmosphere. Their efficiency is doubtful too since: - They placed us in a smoking floor without asking first - When we were leaving they tried to charge us unduly minibar expenses - They wouldn't even apologize for not fixing the wireless access for two days. The only reason to stay here is that the price you pay (al least through the Internet website) is pretty reasonable for a 3 star in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: dapurediva
Reviews.Content: This was really the best hotel we've stayed at. We were extremely impressed with the service, the staff and the LOCATION! It was just a few minutes walking distance from all the major sites. I would stay at this hotel EVERY SINGLE TIME I visit Barcelona. Why mess with perfection? PS: I don't think I've ever written such a raving review about a hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, challenging location”
Reviews.Author: btnusa
Reviews.Content: The location is OK. It is in a very safe and clean area (L’Eixample) but the area was somewhat dead for restaurants and bars. There were limited quality restaurants within a short walk. Dinner around Sagrada Familia is poor. I recommend the short walk on Gran Via (towards La Rambla) or the longer walk to La Ribera. It is near a train station. The breakfast was typical European and good. The rooms were new and very clean. There is a mini bar and TV. There is an elevator and rooms have AC. Nice bathrooms. Free wireless internet in room. The staff was very nice but didn’t seem very knowledgeable about getting around town. Maybe they deal with more business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Elvtars
Reviews.Content: We paid more for this hotel than for several luxury hotels elsewhere in Spain. Did we receive the same or better service? Of course not. Why I am still saying it is good value for money? Because it was. Here is the thing we didn't know. Barcelona is a very popular weekend destination. Discount airlines offer convenient, cheap flights from many major European cities. Hotels take advantage of this and prices almost double for the weekend. This is lesson number one. Avoid the weekend if you can. The second thing that we didn't know was that with its first class facilities, Barcelona hosts many important international events thorough the year. The hotels take advantage and prices go up some more. This is lesson number two. Check the events calendar and try to avoid the major ones, unless you are interested in attending them. Because we didn't know this, we planned our stay for the weekend of the (Formula 1) Barcelona Grand Prix! Needles to say, finding a hotel within our budget became a nightmare. Finally, we found the Aranea Hotel. We were very satisfied with the Aranea, perhaps because we didn't expect much. It offered a very decent room for a reasonable (under the circumstances) price. Nothing really outstanding, nothing really bad, not too much to talk about. Some scratches on the walls and a half-broken hairdryer are the only bad things I could bring up. On the other hand, the hotel staff was really nice. It helped us with some tourist information and with recommending some nice restaurants nearby. The room was impeccably made up and restocked every day. The location is good, but not great. The Sagrada Familia is only a few blocks away. The other attractions towards the city centre are a more longish walk away. There are a couple of metro stations nearby, not really close, about three blocks from the hotel. Taxis are probably more convenient. They are plentiful, can be hailed from the street and because trips are short, they don't cost much. We had breakfast at the hotel twice. It was good, but we had better elsewhere. OK, this is perhaps an unfair comparison, since those were higher category hotels.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: MissV22
Reviews.Content: The location, the cleanliness and politeness of staff were very good, earning the majority of the score. You have the Gaudi sites a short walk north and the gothic / born quarters a short 15-20 minute walk below. I only got on public transport once in 4 days to go to parc Guell, but I do like to walk! There was nothing wrong with the hotel at all but a bit typically bland and soulless - will definitely return to Barcelona but for the price will rent an apartment. Barcelona hotels are expensive and the Apsis Aranea did seem better value and quieter than the ones in the Gothic Quarter (which I can imagine are invaded with street noise day and night). The room was small and so was the "double" bed - a UK single and a half really. These corner rooms and the beds are much smaller but apparently quieter. However, the room did have an ajoining door to the next room and you could hear conversations and the shower. The only other amenities were a handy safe in the room and a rooftop terrace (which they could do more with really). I didn't bother with the breakfast at the hotel. It was far too expensive and there are a lot of good bakery's and cafes nearby. If you are after a clean, safe hotel to go back to after sightseeing days and late evenings then this is it. If you want a hotel to chill out and spend time in and be surrounded in the style and funkiness that Barcelona has in abundance, spend a bit more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: BrightonMandi
Reviews.Content: We loved our short stay here. It was just a 15 minute walk into the heart of barcelona and far enough away to be peaceful at night. It was spotlessly clean with lovely, friendly helpful staff. Clean fluffy towels were replaced every day which is a novelty. We would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “No life or soul at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ciaranroddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel based mainly on the details and photographs provided on the hotels web site in conjunction with previous reviews on Trip Advisor. Whereas we were more than happy with the room we were dissapointed with the facilities and it's location. The overall appearance of the hotel was good it was bright airy and tastefully decorated. The room was the same. It was more than adequate. Each night when we came back from a full days sight seeing we would have liked to sat at the bar and have a few drinks to wind down. This was not possible as the bar was not open. During our entire stay the bar never opened once. Similarly the restaurant seemed to close after lunch. It was not to say that we arrived back at the hotel late each night, it was only 10pm. We ended up going arround the corner to a local Tapas bar and had drinks there. Furthermore their website describes their location as 100 meters to La Sagrada Família 1000 meters to Passeig de Gràcia 1200 meters to Plaça Catalunya These descriptions are very liberal with the truth. To get to La Sagrada Familia one had to walk 3 blocks in one direction and then two in another direction. I would estimate this to be at least 700 - 800 m. As regards Passeig de Gracia and Placa Catalunya this first of all involved a walk to La Sagrada Famililia and then jumping on the Metro and then getting off 4 / 5 stops down the line. Overall if you want somewhere closer to the sites and a hotel with some life and soul, don't stay here. It is not worth the money. On my return I visited their website again to leave some feed back but guess what, the link has been disabled. I wonder why.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: desitraveller23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our 3 night stay at Apsis Aranea. The hotel is modern and functional. The room was cleaned and towels changed everyday. Break fast was included and had something for all tastes(we are vegetarians and this was not a problem) Many reviews complain about the bed and the TV, but we didnt find this a problem. The bed was fine and as far as the TV is concerned, we only we there to sleep and not watch TV, which I expect is what most people will go to Barcelona for! The hotel is about 15 to 20 minutes walk to Placa Catalunya. La Sagrada familia is only a short 10 minute walk from the hotel. There are a few cafes and shops around the hotel. The area felt safe at all times of the day. Barcelona is built for pedestrians, we were impressed by the pavements in Barcelona which were in most cases wider than the roads!! Tetuan metro station is only 5 minutes from the hotel. The metro system in Barcelona is very cheap and convenient, but we walked to most places, which is the best way to see Barcelona and all its amazing buildings. Occasionally we took the metro in the evenings when we were tired. We bought a T-10 card which was sufficient for our entire 4 day stay: one T-10 card can be shared between any number of people. Be very wary of taking taxis from the Airport, they sometimes try to rip you off. Our taxi driver tried to charge us 38 euros even though the meter only indicated 21 euros (he types 38 into the keypad!!). I'd suggest if this happens, get out and ask the hotel staff to help you, especially if you do not speak much spanish! One the way back to Barcelona airport we took the metro to Sants Estacia station and took the RENFEE train to 'Aeroport' which takes 20 mins from Sants. I did a bit of research about top places to visit and veggie restaurants. If anyone wants the list, send me a message and will email it to you. Enjoy Barcelona! We did!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CouplefromCardiff
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and the rooms reasonably appointed. Reception staff were extremely helpful and helped us with quetions & problems we had. Location was OK, but not as described on the Hotel website. The bus station was about 20 minutes walk & the nearest metro was Monumental about 10 mins away. For a city hotel the rooms were quiet, despite traffic below. Breakfast is more of a Continental style with only 2 hot dishes which, although good, is as usual overpriced in hotels. Great little restaurant\bar a few doors away. Doesn't look much from outside but served great tapas very reasonably. Have rated above average because is rated as a 3*.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: hayglopainting
Reviews.Content: Regarding the last review about this hotel - it did make me a little nervous as the general view has been great. However - I was celebrating our 4th anniversary with my partner - and wanted a memorable hotel. Having been to Barcelona before and stayed in the La Ramblas...I didn't want to go there again - as overpriced, and red light district springs to mind. So I'm happy to say that the Apsis Aranea is none of that. We flew Ryanair and landed into Girona - you can get a bus striaght from the airport and into the bus station at Barcelona (aprox 70mins) then its a 5min walk from the bus station to the hotel....literally a striaght line - sounds like a trek - but since we got flights fro £50pp - that was fine - bus tickets were 21euro for a return. On arrival - the reception was friendly and our room ready - earlier then expected. Okay, okay - rooms are small - but after the reviews I read - I knew what to expect - but you know what - it's clean - comfortable and laid out very well - besides - a hotel is somewhere to sleep comfortably - your not going to spend ALL your time there....are you? La Ramblas is about a 15min walk away - and the Sagrada Familia - abou 10mins....OR you can get the metro - about 5mins walk away - all in all - best way to see Barcelona is by foot. And a cab back from the "Old City" won't set you back anymore then 6euros. We felt very safe round the area of the hotel - lots of bright lights, etc - didn't run into trouble with the renowned pick pockets - but being from London orginally - we're already street savy - a lot of it is common sense, wallet in the front pockets for men - handbags held close for women! Breakfast was included in the price of our stay - for 2nights and breakfast, inc tax - we paid £114 for 2people...pretty good I say. Breakfast was the usual continental, ham, cheese, fruits, cereal, etc - it set us up for the day. We booked through: [--] - who were also fabulous! I thoroughly recommend this hotel if you are on a budget - you'll get a decent night's sleep....though as with all hotels - bring earplugs - it's your own fault if you don't!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean and not much more!”
Reviews.Author: AdeEndacott
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the 28th of November 2007 and have mixed conclusions of the experience. My trip was for business and the hotel was dictated by our associate or we would never have considered this venue. The hotel itself is very very clean, in every way and the reception staff were reasonably helpful. We also had WiFi in the room. That's where it stopped. The rooms are small, very small. There are 11 TV channels, 10 in Spanish and 1 other, CNN. Pay TV was not working. Do not pay for breakfast. It's rubbish. After taking a look over the offering, we chose to go out for breakfast. We would have liked a bar or lounge to meet in or wind up or down! No such luck. The location is rubbish too. There are no good bars or restaurants in walking distance. So if you want small, clean and WiFi only, this cheap hotel is for you. If you need a bar or lounge and fancy some TV late at night or a tasty meal. Steer clear. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Vovchik
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. As suggested by other reviewers we requested the top floor to minimize the street noise. We end up staying in room 701 (top floor right across from elevators). It turned out that both elevators had some sort of switch/relay box right next to the doors and at night they kept switching on and off and the switching noise can be heard from the room. So if you're a light sleeper, do not stay on the 7th floor. The room was actually descent size and a very nice and clean bathroom. The breakfast was OK, nothing special. Some cold cuts, coffee, juices. When something runs out, girls that wait the counter took their time with refilling it. Location is about 25 minute walk from the center. We end up buying metro card (10 rides for 7 euros) and took subway back to the hotel which stops 4 small blocks from the hotel (5 minute walk). There's a supermarket few doors down where we shopped for water, wine and snacks (good prices). Overall, descent room, OK breakfast, good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catd1
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for 3 nights in september 2006. I am a real clean freak and worry that hotels will not be up to my standard - however, this hotel did not let me down. Spotlessly clean with nice laminate floors and white bed linen. The hotel is not for those who want something bang in the middle of La Rambas, but it is only 7mins or so from La Sagrada Familia and the tube isn't much of a walk either. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, instead we found a lovely, clean and cheap cafe near by. All in all, perfect short break in barcelona, clean and comfortable hotel in quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ian-NewZealand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights from September 3. Three of us had adjoining rooms on the 7th floor. The rooms were a bit small but the bathroom was large in comparison, There are wooden floors which are bit noisey but this is compensated by being in a quiet part of town, and the house maids are very efficient. The reception staff are very helpful and speak very good English. We used taxis quite a bit as we found them quite cheap. One tip though, if you have suitcases, make sure you load them in and out of the taxi otherwise the over eager drivers charge 6 Euro a case for loading them for you. We found the breakfasts too dear at 11 Euro a head, but for 8 Euros I bought a weeks supply of breakfasts from a supermarket 2 blocks away and ate in our rooms. The rooms had a reasonable good size safe in the closet. I was relieved of my wallet and contents the first day on Las Ramblas but unbelieveably retrieved it back within seconds fully in tact I suspect the timely arrival of two police officers on the beat just at that time assisted in the abandonment of the crime. What was a problem was we don't speak Spanish. We were advised that this would not be a problem as almost everybody there speaks English - Wrong - Very few people either don't speak English or can't be bothered if you can't speak Spanish and we found those people openly rude to us. Most taxi drivers are in this category. I would definately stay here again. The free internet in the lobby was a bonus, We also recommend that you try eating down at the Olympic Villiage at Barcelonetta There are some great deal, like 5 courses for 17 Euros, avoid eating on or near Las Ramblas as they rip you off.

Reviews.Title: “Good Home Base”
Reviews.Author: teena1014
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Apsis Aranea for 9 nights. The hotel staff was great and the hotel itself was very clean. The value was great as I booked well in advance on the hotel website. The breakfast was convenient with a good choice of items, although a bit expensive considering you could go to a local bakery or supermarket for much less. There was a safe and minibar in the room...the safe is needed to store cash and credit cards so you're not walking around with excess. There was also wireless internet access in the room if you choose to bring your laptop. The only complaint, the TV didn't work...not even one channel. We're in a bad habit of sleeping with it on. Even though this location isn't close, we didn't mind. There is a Metro station very close and the Metro is very easy to navigate. You could also walk, and we did at times, although it was a 20-30 min walk to Las Rambles.

Reviews.Title: “clean and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: msnmsn
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in June. The desk staff were very accommodating. Spoke English well. Very clean room, altho' somewhat small but with a large well-equipped bath. The location was a short walk to the Sagrada Familia but not near anything else. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: Cassiya
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Apsis Aranea and the location of this hotel is superb. It is two blocks from the Sagrada Famillia, 15mins walk from the Arc de Triumf and Girona metro station close by. When we arrived all the double rooms were booked up and we had to take a twin room as an alternative. The staff was very friendly and helpful in making sure we got a double room the next day. The twin room had a far bigger bathroom than the double room. Overall this hotel was very convenient and situated in a good part of Barcelona. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: njG-man
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood and has vey nice modern rooms and bath. Short walk to Batllo and Sagrada Familia. Short cab ride to Pl. Catalyuna. Very friendly hotel staff. Free Internet in lobby. Free safe in room. Did not have breakfast. I stayed in a single room 402 for 4 nights and paid Euro 80 + VAT per night. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TravelgirlRi
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews of this hotel and were not disappointed. The hotel was spotlessly clean, staff was extremely courteous and friendly and we found the location to be good. Easy walk to Sagrada Familia, buses and the metro. The hotel is located in a residential area. We felt extremely safe at all hours. Even late at night when we stepped out to use the pay phone to make international phone calls. Free internet access in the business center. The only drawback is the hardness of the bed and not much closet/drawer space. I would definitely stay again and heartily recommend Apsis Aranea if you are looking for a safe, friendly, clean, affordable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Ginger_Rachel
Reviews.Content: We booked to stop at Hotel Apsis Aranea for 4 nights after reading the reviews on this website and weren't disappointed. We arrived late in the evening (about 11.30) after flying from Liverpool. As we flew with Ryanir, the airport was a good 1 hour bus journey away, however the bus station is only 6 blocks walk from the hotel. Although it was dark and quiet, we felt very safe walking 10-15 mins. Definitely no need for a taxi. When we walked through the doors, the night porter greeted us by name, knowing that we were checking in late (I had emailed ahead) and were probably also the last to check in. However I thought it was a lovely touch and made us feel very welcome after a tiring journey. We had a room overlooking the front street and the intersection. Although it was quite busy during the day, noise wasn't a problem and was very quiet at night. The decor was lovely - very minimal, white cotton sheets and not a disgusting multi-coloured bed throw in sight! The room was quite small, but we already knew and it wasn't a problem for the two of us. Easy walking distance to Sagrada Familia and the Ramblas - although if you are tired of walking there is a metro nearby. We found it great being a short way out of the main tourist area just simply for the quiet. Plus there are lots of fantastic buildings to admire as you are walking. Great location, great service. No faults. It's also worth mentioning that we didn't sign up for breakfast because the previous reviews we read mentioned the smokey dining room. On arrival we found that it had recently converted to non-smoking!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money, location is decent”
Reviews.Author: bparker245
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Hotel is clean, in good condition, staff speaks good English and are very helpful. Room was average for Europe in size, but the beds were very hard. Queen bed is 2 twins pushed together (very common in Europe). If not for the bed, I'd rate it higher. Didn't eat at the hotel, but there are plenty of places nearby to eat. Location is pretty good--near La Familia (main church in Barcelona). To get to the main shopping area, its about a 10 minute walk. Trams are nearby too, though. Its not too close to the beach either, but that didn't bother us. We were not there for the beach. if you wanted to walk to the beach, I'd say it'd take about 20-25 minutes. Cab ride is quick, though. Hotel is on an intersection that is fairly busy during the day, but not at night. Noise was not an issue. Overall, I'd stay here again if visiting Barcelona. It was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a good location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: RichRichRich
Reviews.Content: We moved here from another part of town to be closer to the sights. This hotel is NOT really close to anything except the sagrada familia (4 blocks) but is much closer than the business district. This hotel is fine, very new, pretty, clean, and neat, but: 1. Rooms are quite small (not a big deal). 2. Hardwood floors mean that the halls and rooms are quite loud. 3. Staff is indifferent. Oh, and the first night a whole fraternity of american kids partied in the room next door. Thank god they went out clubbing.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: iHeartToTravel
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, quiet area, exceptionally modern rooms. Within walking distance to Metro, felt extremely safe any time of day. Business center offered free internet usage, although we had to wait 15 minutes, there was a nice lounge area with books to read about Barcelona. English speaking staff was quite helpful; they even let us keep our luggage at the hotel when we flew to Rome for two days during our trip. Lovely hotel would gladly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good !!!”
Reviews.Author: hirakata
Reviews.Content: I was refered to this hotel by anothe rof the Apsis hotels and was very satisfied. Very clean and sleek but at the same time the staff made you feel at ease and welcome. Rooms and facilities - excellent. The free comnputer room was a godsend as i had to try and book flights at the last minute. Location is away from the main sights but the metro is only 5 minutes walk so its easy to get around. Also its not so touristy and crowded in this area, so its not as frenetic as the Plaza Catalunya and Ramblas area

Reviews.Title: “Practical comments - please read the NB”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night break (Friday out, Tuesday return). The hotel is in a residential area and is well served by local facilities - supermarket, fruit & veg shops, bar-restaurants, pharmacies and pastry/coffee shops. It's a few blocks walk to the nearest tube stations and Sagrada Familia. The hotel is clean, bright and recently decorated. We didn't eat in, as breakfast is better taken in coffee shops like the locals and we were never there for lunchtime. If you book here, I would advise using the hotel's own web site. You will get reservation & cancellation numbers. It may be possible to cancel/rebook and get a cheaper deal. NB - all visitors. Several rooms per floor are at the back of the hotel and have a view of concrete/brick walls only - but for this I would have rated the hotel higher, unfortunately the hotel was full and so we could not change. The only advantage to being at the back is that the room was very quiet. However, the area is not noisy at night so I would recommend specifying a front facing in your booking. The bedroom we had was on the small size (shoe prints on the wall either side of the bed!!!), though the bathroom was excellent. The air-con was effective, though too noisey to run at night. Hotel staff are multi-lingual. All in, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last August (2005). I would definatly recommend it. It's in a quiet location about 15 mins walk to Las Ramblas. Room a little small but very modern and spotlessly clean. Room made up every day and clean towels left. Metro station just up the road. Staff friendly and helpful. Didn't bother with breakfast so can't comment on it but its as good as i've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: icelolly08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in feb 2005, travelled from prestwick airport, bus trip took about 45-60 mins but again we were lucky as bus stop only 5-10 min walk to hotel so great. we travelled with a two year old who had just left her cot and just started sleeping in a cot bed, we arrived later in the evening so keen to get settled. On arrival hotel was clean and very stylish, room was on 3rd floor to the rear, but to our horror the windows did not lock we had booked a triple bed rm, we promplty asked to be moved as this window issue was a danger to our 2 yr old, but told no rooms avaiable until the morning, so we never slept a wink. Moved next day to the lowest floor, but they could only offer a double bed for 3 of us to sleep in!!! with no reduction in room rate. so apart from that drama the hotel is lovely wooden floors/ modern. The breakfast was inculded, only issue was it was full of smokers which is disgusting at 8 am trying to eat and breathing in smoke and our daughter had to put up with this, either should be like Milan banned in all eating places and soon Scotland :-) So round up lovely but dont take small kids, you will also love it if you smoke and eat at the same time!

Reviews.Title: “More of an upscale B and B than a hotel proper. Internet rate OK value.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Quiet-ish location towards Sagrada Familia. 20 mins walk to top of Ramblas, 10 to Sagrada Familia. Travel light and you can get the metro from the airport to Catalunya station then walk 20 mins to the hotel. Desk staff almost all* cheerful and helpful. Minimal public space. No bar, no restaurant apart from breakfast, but decent catering at various price points round every corner. "24 hour business centre" advertised on the website did not appear to exist but wifi available in a small TV lounge. Room minimally furnished but not unpleasant; limited stowage though - nowhere to park your suitcase apart from on the floor (anothe reason to travel light); short of countertop space in the bathroom. Ample stock of good sized towels. Comfortable bed. No "do not disturb" sign for the door... so annoyingly woken from deep slumber by over eager maid at 9 am after a very late Friday night. This was our first experience of the Apsis chain and on the whole, impressed. *I've got some sympathy for hospitality workers in Barcelona who must surely suffer from tourist fatigue but mostly hide it well!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: amberVenice
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 nights stay at the Apsis Aranea, the hotel were situated in a good location in the city center away from the crowds, just 15 minutes walking to Plaça Catalunya, however if you don't want to risk to get lost (all the streets are quite similar) use the underground to move around... The only thing for which I was a little disappointed was the room, when we reserved it we asked for a queen bedded room and they confirmed it but at the check in the receptionist told me that there was just one room available with a queen size bed and that it had an internal view, all the other rooms available had twin beds...in fact the room was small and the view was over all the pipes of the hotel. Instead the bathroom was modern and very clean. The breakfast was average. Anyway, Barcelona is a beautiful city and I will surely come back but I'm not sure i will come back at the Hotel Aranea.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mates and I stayed at the Apsis Arenea for the U2 gig last August. About €25 from the Airport. Real handy for the Sagrada Famillia (about 5 minutes walk) and about 15 minutes walk to the Place De La Cataolnia. Room was small but modern and clean. Reception is modern and clean. The breakfast area is in the basement off the reception. Note: Get down early for breakfast as it stops at 1000 Hrs and not 1001 hrs and the staff are very effecient at clearing the breakfast bar in under 5 minutes flat.. Breakfast was hot buffet style and of great value. No problem recommending this to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pavfec
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Apsis Aranea during our honeymoon. We really liked the location - a quieter street, near 2 metro stations, grocery stores, cafes, bars and sights. There are several cafes in the area where you can get toast or pastry and coffee for breakfast for a couple of Euros. The city centre is doable on foot. The rooms were clean and staff were friendly. We would definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: bigjules
Reviews.Content: We thought the breakfast was not value for money. They had cheese, garlic meats, toast and poached eggs. As we only had toast and poached eggs at (11 euros each) we thought that was a lot of money. The staff were too busy clearing tables instead of checking that the food bar had enough food on it. We had to ask every morning for the dishes to be filled up. Sometimes we waited 15 minutes for poached eggs and the tea-bags were extremely weak. The hotel was very clean and all we would say is 'do not have breakfast there'

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel if you like staying away from major tourist areas and rather soak in more of the local people, sights. We got a room overlooking the intersection and had a great view. The windows are double paned and filter out the traffic noise. The only noise issues was one night some little kid down the hall was having a tantrum. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and the bathrooms are large for European standards. The staff is very friendly. Never had any problems with housekeeping at all. If you get a room on the 2nd level you might be able to get free wireless leaking up from the lobby. Otherwise, there is free wireless in the lobby. There's a nice little seating area with a large screen tv and some books that has wireless internet. Las Ramblas is about a 10 minute walk and Sagrada Familia is about a 5 minute walk. We only rode the metro once, mainly just to ride it. Skip the provided breakfast. There's a great bakery and supermarket literally half a block away. We bought stuff there and ate in our room or in the park. There's also a nice 24 hour locals place a few doors down that is part bar/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: dereks9658
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel and enjoyed them all. Room was spotless and very comfortable, staff were all most helpful. Recommend breakfast and lunch at the hotel (lunch particularly good value), but no evening meals available and the bar closes by 10:00

Reviews.Title: “More than served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: RSnapey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights, and I have to say that for what you pay it's an excellent choice. The rooms are clean, bright and modern with Air Conditioning so you don't have to leave your window open to the traffic noise, although this isn't bad at night. The location is good, just 5 minutes walk from Sagrada Familia and about 20 minutes walk from La Rambla. If you don't fancy the walk, the Tube is a cheap and easy option. The Hotel staff were helpful and multi lingual, and they'll stoore your bags for you if you arrive too early or if your flights quite a few hours after check-out. It's convienient for the airports, with our taxi from Barcelona airport costing just over 20 euros. All in all I thought this was an outstanding Hotel for just over £50 a night, and would definitely go back there next time we visit this fantastic City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travellerwithfamily
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean rooms however staff were very reserved and spoke minimal English. Breakfast passable but nothing to write home.

HotelInfo.Name: GBB Hotel Aranea
HotelInfo.Address: Carrer Consell de Cent, 444, 08013 Barcelona, Spain
